name: Finley Community Park Pickleball Courts
description: Finley Community Park in Santa Rosa offers 12 outdoor pickleball courts (4 dedicated and 8 with dual tennis lines) on concrete surfaces. Courts are open daily from sunrise to sunset and are free to use. Restrooms are available on site. No lights, so play ends at dusk.

name: Howarth Park Pickleball Courts
description: Howarth Park in Santa Rosa has four dedicated outdoor pickleball courts on a hard surface. The courts are lighted and open daily, with lights off at 10:00pm. Restrooms and water fountains are available on site. There is no fee to play, and courts are first-come, first-served.

name: Lucchesi Park Pickleball Courts
description: Lucchesi Park in Petaluma features four dedicated outdoor pickleball courts with permanent nets and lights. Courts are open for free drop-in play daily from dawn to dusk, and do not require reservations. Restrooms and parking are available on site.

name: Del Oro Park Pickleball Court
description: Del Oro Park in Petaluma has a single outdoor tennis court striped for pickleball. The court is free to use daily (dawn to dusk) and is first-come, first-served. There are no lights, so play is during daylight only. Restrooms are available at the park.

name: Sunflower Park Pickleball Courts
description: Sunflower Park in Cotati offers two outdoor concrete tennis courts striped for pickleball. These unlit courts are open daily from 8:00am to 7:00pm (no play at night). The courts are free to use. No net is provided (players must bring a net). Restrooms are available at the park.

name: Sunrise Park Pickleball Courts
description: Sunrise Park in Rohnert Park has twelve outdoor hard pickleball courts (6 dedicated and 6 multi-use) with permanent nets and lights. Courts are open daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm (lights on). The courts are free and managed by the Rohnert Park Pickleball Club. The park provides restrooms and parking.
open_play_schedule: Open play daily 8:00am - noon (club) and afternoons/evenings

name: Giorgi Park Pickleball Courts
description: Giorgi Park in Healdsburg has two multi-use outdoor courts (tennis and pickleball). These courts are striped for pickleball and open to the public daily. Winter hours are 8:00am-5:00pm; summer hours extend to 8:00pm. There are no lights. Play is free and first-come, first-served.

name: Abel De Luna Community Center Pickleball Court
description: The Abel De Luna Community Center in Healdsburg offers one indoor lighted pickleball court. It is used for scheduled play (M/W/F 8am-1pm, T/Th 8am-2:30pm). Drop-in play is managed via online reservations. The court is open to the public when available; no additional fees are charged beyond facility use.
hours: Hours vary by schedule (see city website)
fees: Free use; reservations required for open play

name: Healdsburg High School Pickleball Courts
description: Healdsburg High School sports complex has four dedicated outdoor pickleball courts (converted from underused tennis courts). These courts are available to the public when the school is not using them. Lights are provided (on until 8pm). Courts are free to play and open drop-in before/after school hours and weekends.
hours: Open for public drop-in (outside school hours)
open_play_schedule: Public open play M-F 4-8pm, weekends all day (school permitting)

name: Brook Haven Middle School Pickleball Courts
description: Brook Haven Middle School in Sebastopol has three outdoor tennis courts with permanent pickleball lines. The courts are lighted and available for free public play on weekends and after 3pm on weekdays. Nets are not provided. Play is first-come, first-served.

name: Furber Park Pickleball Courts
description: Furber Park in Cloverdale has two dedicated outdoor pickleball courts. They are open daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm (lights off at 10pm). No fees or reservations are required. Restrooms are available. Courts have permanent pickleball lines on concrete surface.

name: Henry N. Pacheco Memorial Park Pickleball Courts
description: Pacheco Park in Guerneville has two outdoor tennis courts striped for pickleball. The courts are open daily from dawn to dusk on a first-come, first-served basis. A portable restroom is onsite. No nets are provided. Play is free of charge.

name: Occidental Community Center Pickleball Courts
description: The Occidental Community Center has four outdoor dedicated pickleball courts (added during 2023 renovations) on a hard surface. Courts are open daily from sunrise to sunset and are free to use. Restrooms and parking are available. Note: the town website mentions 2 courts, but Sonoma County sources indicate 4 courts.

name: Monte Rio Pickleball Courts
description: The Monte Rio recreation area (on Main Street) has two outdoor concrete courts (part of the tennis courts) lined for pickleball. Courts are free to use daily from dawn to dusk. Restrooms and water are available. There are no net posts (players bring nets).
